Photo of York & Albany - London, United Kingdom

4keIkJoaFqXPcQAu4de-vA.text: I had a good lunch here, it is a little above itself as a location. the food was good but not worth the expense and the staff felt they wanted us to get out of their way a lot of the time. It did kind of feel like they did not want to serve us at all, and then when they finally did the food that arrived was not as hot as i would of liked. I would say 2 stars but I really liked the building so it gets an extra one for that.

i3vUmIzmpAm3twVht2opOw.text: Please do yourself a favour and avoid. This place is almost comical with its terrible service and poor (for the £££) food. Reading other reviews I assumed the Americans just had different expectations with service. I was wrong. This place is seriously bad - even by normal/average London service levels. At the price you're paying here there are many better options to look at. Forget the G. Ramsay thing it's irrelevant in practice here...and he should he ashamed to have his name involved with this.

3hCsRqGMan-e-SwWMvaLDw.text: While our main waiter was perfectly pleasant, he was basically absent. It took an hour to be able to order (having taken 30 minutes for the cocktail menu to appear and we were the only one's in the restaurant at that time) and then another 45 mins to pay the bill - we finally went up and asked. This was a shame, as the food was good and was brought by the serving staff in good time. For a meal that costs as much as this one does, I expect a lot more.As a party of 6, we were having a lovely time, so weren't that distressed (except about the cocktail menu - not ok!), but it did take us 4.5 hours to have dinner.The food was fantastic, but it's not cheap and I expect service to match the food and prices, which sadly it just really didn't.Oh side note: Don't order off the cocktail menu - they have a full bar, but they don't seem to really know how to make off-menu drinks. The four people who ordered on menu had lovely cocktails, and the two of us who tried something else were a bit let down.

PWnJ0fePfIJ67MyzRnQJKQ.text: I discovered this place by chance after finding everywhere else in Camden was busy. And this place had lovely outdoor seating at the front and amazing restaurant seating inside with an open kitchen and a beautiful bar. We tried their unique cocktails and ordered again and again. Plus their freshly made pizza and the chunkiest hips ever was a perfect unplanned dinner. On a second visit tried the sea bass with the mash potatoes baked perfectly. Would recommend to anyone.

photos.caption: Photo of York & Albany - London, United Kingdom. The complimentary birthday cake, very kind of them
Photo of York & Albany - London, United Kingdom. Unique cocktails featuring spirits and red wine

B4x7kcgUW0AJuuxiZh0vyg.text: Came here for afternoon tea week and really enjoyed my experience! The service was amazing and the food - for the most part - was great too. We had reservations for 3 pm and were seated right away in at a lovely table by the window. I (unsurprisingly) ordered the afternoon tea set with green tea. Within 5 minutes the tea came out and within another 5 minutes our tower arrived. My goodness, I was SO excited when I saw it - everything looked beautiful, from the sandwiches to the raspberry trifle.Now onto the actual taste. I enjoyed the sandwiches for the most part (salmon was definitely my favorite but I love salmon anyway), but the bread was softer than I would've preferred and it often stuck to the roof of my mouth which I didn't like so much. As for the sweets, the trifle tasted amazing - just not the whipped cream on top, which I thought made the dessert a bit too heavy. The pistachio macaron was...let's say, interesting. It wasn't your traditional macaron - the inside was very runny and the shell wasn't soft on the inside, which is a requirement I have for good macaroons. The taste was decent, though. The eclair was pretty good, but perhaps had a little too much chocolate drizzle on the top. The blueberry tart had a great taste - I just wish the texture would have been softer/easier to cut through. And the scones...I don't know what it is about British scones but that's the part of afternoon tea that I always look forward to most! These scones did not disappoint, and neither did the clotted cream/jam. The flavor was on point and although the texture could have been softer/more melty on the inside and perhaps served warm as well, I enjoyed it.Overall, I'd recommend this place for afternoon tea. While - looking back - the food was decent but nothing particularly special, the service was spectacular and so was the tea. Definitely try to come here for afternoon tea before the week ends! It's an incredible offer for what you get.

photos.caption: Photo of York & Albany - London, United Kingdom. Afternoon tea

chzNjTzUjSYXkWPXgzWK6Q.text: My cousin and I came here for dinner after work to wait for the rush hour to die down before heading back home. As we were dining early we chose the set menu they had available until 7 pm. Very good selection and I had the plaice which was cooked to perfection. Had the brownie and caramel ice cream for dessert which was also good. Great dining experience. Service was good and friendly.

Q7t8KOomBeY0B9X-IO2hug.text: We originally booked Christmas dinner here because we knew it was a Gordon Ramsay restaurant and we had a WONDERFUL experience at Heddon Street Kitchen (another Ramsay restaurant). Unfortunately, it was bad almost as soon as we entered the place. To begin, there was an awkward coat check. The person running the coat check was very kind, and probably the best staff we had all evening, but we were awkwardly taking off our coats and handing them to him while also being rushed to our table. Another note about the coat check system is that at the end of the evening they had trouble locating our coats so we had to search through the awkwardly placed closet ourselves. Upon sitting down we waited a good while for anyone to pay attention to us and take our orders; 20 minutes. The next issue was the drinks came after two starter courses. However, we did have water at the table. My main course was beef wellington and it was quite apparent it sat under a heat lamp. It was barely warm when it arrived at my table and got cool very quickly; unpleasant. The courses were also timed oddly. We never had one consistent waiter attending to us, when they even bothered to act like we were there. Glasses piled up on the table and we were asked about a refill or other beverage once during the meal, and that was after WE got someone's attention. It all felt very uncomfortable, awkward, and confusing. The soup at the start of the evening and the dessert at the end were the highlights; both delicious. Overall, our experience was unpleasant and disappointing, especially when considering it was a Christmas meal we paid quite a bit for.

rr7OEAvh3wryrwooKm7ajQ.text: Very satisfied with early supper experience at York and Albany while in London last year. Walked in without reservations on a weekend, no problem, Great food and ambiance. The service matched the food:Impeccable. I am not just saying that because i am american and usually dine at Burker King and Subway ; ) Everything was fresh, the wine list phenomenal and we look forward to our next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of York & Albany - London, United Kingdom. Inside York and Alabany's Nonnas

q7lfFJioru27uMer1inm8w.text: I think Mr. Ramsey needs to check in regarding QC at this place. We were a party of 6 adults and 2 children. Although the waiter was great at ensuring the kids got fed quickly and also correctly ensured two in our party had the changes to their meals (one with no mustard in mash and the other switching mash to chips), the food was sub par.Braised cheeks with mash were barely warm and the mash was cold. As anyone with kids in tow knows, one does not have the luxury to send a meal back or they risk running the meal too late for impatient toddlers. So, 3 of us suffered through those plates. One of us also found that the beer he had at first had run out before he ordered his second one - and it was only 6:15pm!!Worst of all follows:Saturdays prime roast special was... fish pie (no roasts available)!  Really??Desserts were plain awful. Toffee pudding was more like a dried cake and was served without any sauce. Tarte tatin was a precooked slice upside down apple pie with a whisp of caramel. Last time we were here we thought some of the issues were one off problems. This trip confirmed it - save your money and eat elsewhere until Mr. Ramsey does a shake up in this namesake restaurant!
